overview_of_class:
How have people tried to explain what their lives mean? How have historical actors come to understand more abstract features of their society - such as religion, nationalism, race, gender, and sexuality - in relation to themselves? How do new historical contexts create new understanding of the self?

To address these questions, we will consider autobiographical primary sources ranging from medieval love letters to memoirs of the Holocaust; experiences of trench warfare, artistic creation, and spiritual awakening; lives changed by scientific discovery, fighting duels, and running away from home.
name: First-Year Seminar-European History
topic: Autobiography and the Self in European History
class_attributes:
WCAS First-Year Seminar

Attendance at 1st class mandatory

Freshmen/Sophomores Only
subject: HISTORY
